title: Please buff the towers.
body: Especially with the new Rift herald, you'd think it'd make sense. We don't need games to end in 20 minutes. Why bother with late-game picks? I really hope I'm overestimating that thing.

I agree towers should be buffed.
 
I think one of the best ways would be faster out of combat regen in addition to being immune to penetration again. 
Being immune to penetration makes it only slightly harder to kill the towers for some champions and it would make them scale more appropriately with their defense scaling over time. 
But the better out of combat regen would encourage to keep up the pressure to ensure it stays in combat often enough to not regen a lot.
While successfully defending it for extended periods of time, by keeping enemies and enemy minions out of it's reach to prevent it from entering combat, would reward you with a healthier tower. 

This would promote interactivity, sitting under tower means it will keep entering combat, just shoving in waves won't be enough to take it down over time either so you will need to force your opponents off by diving/zoning/split pushing/ forcing to defend neutrals etc.
So you can't ultra passively defend nor siege towers.
 

That being said

Herald ought to be a strong siege ability for your team
It takes out towers which don't give a team any permanent advantage since the enemy team can take the same amount of towers regardless

Meanwhile drake gives permanent buff
So it has to be a worthy trade, it has to pose enough of a threat when unleashed and not dealt with that it can actually take out your towers or it probably still won't be worth contesting for how buff the thing is to take down compared to drake.

Giving it a ''timer'' means it will be best to take out when baron is almost coming which will allow your team to setup a 1/4/1 using herald which is an interesting way of putting your enemy in a really tough spot which helps break turtling in the midgame.

Rather than healing I think towers should generate a personal shield over time when out of combat.  It should be pretty slow so that pushing in waves over and over will still wear down turrets, even in the early game, but it would help turrets stand for longer so the jungler doesn't gank you then the jgler and laner don't 100-0 the turret before you get back to lane.

Having turrets be able to fully heal punishes people who get damage on turrets but then get pushed off before finishing it, as well as heavily punishing roaming.  By making it a capped shield it allows roamers to negate a bit of tower damage while also not punishing them for roaming too long.

Maybe having the shield scale with game length so it is a fairly small shield early.
Tower diving is fine when champs like {{champion:19}} are designed for it, but when every single person as every champs starts doing it, there's a problem.

I've dived through two towers in a row as Xerath to finish off kills xD

Mind you that was around the end of the mid game, but it still felt stupid (took like 7+ shots?).

Ever see a Ryze tank 5+ Turret shots and get away scot free even after somehow fucking it up?

Turrets are only getting weaker as the patches go on for some reason.

Easiest way to fix turrets is revert the a few of the changes that made them weaker and then a damage buff. Turrets are still effected by Flat Penetration for the simple fact of removing this will destroy a ton of champions and builds from Sieging. Don't worry, they'll still get a few changes to make them stronger and more sturdy.

- Damage Dealt to Turrets per auto attack: ~~100% of your attack damage or your base AD + 50% ability power depending on which is higher~~ --> 100% of your attack damage + 25% ability power. (Overall nerf to mage's pushing but fixes pushing for hybrid champions like Jax.) Subsequently, Ziggs's passive now deals 2.5x damage to turrets from doubled as compensation.

- Inhib and Nexus turrets now shoot a laser again.

- Turrets now get +30 Armor and Magic Resist, Bonus Armor/MR when no minions are attacking turret bonus lowered from 200 to 170.

I heavily disagree to damage nerfs only for AP champs to tower and not for AD.  That is the complete opposite direction things should go, imo.  We need more AP champions like Ziggs that can push and threaten towers.  ADCs should not have a monopoly on ranged tower damage; especially when they already clear minions, champion and neutral objectives safer and generally quicker than other champion sub-groups.
So you're saying Ekko should take turrets as fast as marksmen does? Meanwhile hybrid champions, who happen to all be splitpushers, get the shaft?

Yeah especially with the tank update towers will feel even more useless
Tanks should be able to tank towers but I imagine they will take negative damage now, kinda like how they already do but yeah

Another option would be to increase the power gradient between turret tiers. If the outer turrets were significantly weaker than inner turrets, then it would add in a natural brake to snowballing - sure, being a thousand gold ahead means you'll win most straight up fights at low levels, but a thousand gold won't do diddly squat if a turret shot from an inner turret at the seven minute mark knocks off more than half your health.

"First turrets protect you, then you protect turrets" is a decent idea - it changes them from obstacles to objectives as the game goes on - but right now the champion power delta from start of game to even the fifteen minute mark is so large that there's no way to recover from a loss, since turrets go from "dangerous" to "delicious candy" too fast. And yes, competitive games are generally better in an unstable environment (that is, games are more fun when securing a lead results in a genuine mechanical advantage), but it's possible to go too far, to the point where the entire match is decided by who gets first blood + first tower.

Increasing the power gradient between turret tiers means that if you lose the early game, you still can pull back, hunker under T2 turret, farm, and hope to recover. You'll lose map and objective pressure, sure, but you won't be demanding for the ability to surrender at 15 because of mid+jg gank bot lane that nobody noticed coming.
